prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side** The length of the sides is twice the height of the prism. The height of the prism is one-third of the length of the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Sketch a rectangle with the following lines: Line 1: Start Point 0.0, 0.0, End Point 0.0875, 0.0 Line 2: Start Point 0.0875, 0.0, End Point 0.0875, 0.0875 Line 3: Start Point 0.0875, 0.0875, End Point 0.0, 0.0875 Line 4: Start Point 0.0, 0.0875, End Point 0.0, 0.0 The sketch will have one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1) with four lines. Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units along the normal vector. **Intermediate Part 2: A cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, and translation vector 0.0388, 0.0387, 0.75. Sketch a circle with the center at (0.005, 0.005) and radius 0.005. The sketch will have one face and one loop with one circle. Extrude the sketch by 0.05 units along the opposite direction of the normal vector. **Intermediate Part 3: A cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 180.0, and translation vector 0.0388, 0.0487, 0.0. Sketch a circle with the center at (0.005, 0.005) and radius 0.005. The sketch will have one face and one loop with one circle. Extrude the sketch by 0.0406 units along the opposite direction of the normal vector. Note: The dimensions of the cylindrical objects in part 2 and part 3 are the same, and their tapered ends are facing opposite directions. The euler angles for part 3 are set to 180.0 to face the tapered end in the opposite direction.</description>

The dimensions are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The extrusion depth is 0.6545 units, which is measured from the flat top or bottom to the exterior. When the part is combined with preceding CAD models, it adds new material for a net increase in the final shape.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom. The top and bottom surfaces are flat and parallel to each other. The cylinder is centered in the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the Translation Vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.042]. 2. Draw a sketch on the X-Y plane in the new coordinate system. 3. Create a circle in the sketch by defining its center as [0.375, 0.375] and its radius as 0.375. This circle will represent the top surface of the cylinder. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the identity rotation (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.042]. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch in the negative Z-direction (opposite the normal) with a depth of 0.042. Part 2: Set of Cylindrical Objects with Holes and Connections Construct a set of nine CAD models of cylindrical objects with varying shapes and sizes, including holes and connections, set against a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the Translation Vector set to [0.0313, 0.0308, 0.042]. 2. Draw four circles on different planes in the new coordinate system to represent the holes in the cylindrical objects. Three circles should be concentric on the X-Y plane, defined as follows: * Center 1: [0.021, 0.3438], Radius 1: 0.021 * Center 2: [0.3437, 0.6667], Radius 2: 0.021 * Center 3: [0.3451, 0.021], Radius 3: 0.021 * A fourth circle on the Y-Z plane, defined as: * Center 4: [0.6667, 0.3413], Radius 4: 0.021 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6877. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the identity rotation (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector [0.0313, 0.0308, 0.042]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch in the negative Z-direction (opposite the normal) with a depth of 0.042. Observations: * The final shape is a flat, circular object with four evenly spaced holes around its perimeter. The CAD assembly consists of two parts. * Part 1 is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a tapered shape. Its dimensions, as described in the JSON, are: length=0.75, width=0.75, height=0.042. * Part 2, as described, represents a group of interconnected cylindrical objects with holes. Its dimensions, as described in the JSON, are: length=0.6877, width=0.6877, height=0.042. * We can assume the junior designer can handle constraining the curves according to the given shapes.</description>
